text: Olga M. Nazarova (born 28 February 1962) is a Russian former athlete who competed mainly in the 400 metres hurdles. She achieved her best time in the 400m hurdles with 54.82 secs at the Lausanne Grand Prix on 6 July 1994, and won the 400m hurdles title at the 1995 Russian Championships. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan=6 | Representing the |- |1989 |Universiade |Duisburg, West Germany |6th |58.68 |- !colspan=6 | Representing |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |13th (sf) |55.51 |- |rowspan=2|1994 |Goodwill Games |Saint Petersburg, Russia |5th |55.24 |- |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |7th |55.98 |- |1995 |World Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |10th (sf) |56.89 |- !colspan=6|(sf) Indicates overall position in semifinal round |} ==References== Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Russian female hurdlers Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
title: Olga Nazarova (hurdler)
